The Federal-Mogul, Wiper Products (ANCO) facility in Michigan City Indiana is a world class manufacturer of windshield wiper blades.  Chlorine is used in the manufacturer of wiper blades to give the rubber windshield wiper elements a smooth finish so that they will glide smoothly over the windshield.  Chlorine is stored in (3) 2000 lb. cylinders (1 standby, 2 individually connected to the process).  The chlorine is stored in a building adjacent to the manufacturing plant were it is drawn into the process, as a gas,  and mixed with water.  Upon completion of the chlorination process, the chlorine in the water is neutralized prior to disposal.  The process contains alkaline scrubbers to remove chlorine from any process off-gas.  Because the system operates under a vacuum from the regulator to the chlorinators, the risk of a substantial chlorine release to the air is minimal.  The process is equiped with alarms and valved to enable quick isolation of various process elements in the event of an emergency.  The greatest risk of a major chlorine release is associated with the 2000 lb cylinders located in the chlorine storage building. 

It is important to note that ANCO has never had a release of chlorine gas with off-site consequences. 

ANCO is committed to the health & safety of its employees and the community.  To minimize the risks associated with the use of chlorine in its process, ANCO has taken the following steps to prevent or mitigate the consequences of an accidental release of chlorine:

Process Control

   Rigorous compliance with Standards and Codes
   Structured Hazard Analyses
   Comprehensive Preventive Maintenance
   Vacuum gas delivery system with regulators attached directly to chlorine cylinders

Operations and Training

  Documented Operating Procedures 
  Ongoing Employee Training
  Strict Contractor Rules
  Employee Participation and Operations Review

Management and Auditing

  Management of Change Process
  Comprehensive Incident Investigation an

d Corrective Action
  Periodic Compliance Audits

Emergency Response 

  The storage building is equiped with 24-hour chlorine and smoke sensors and alarms.
  The facility maintains a highly trained emergency response team with Level A capability on-site.
   Extensive emergency response equipment, including a Chlorine B-kit, is available on-site.
